website_summaries.verdict: Steel-frame style of carport that will stand up to tough weather nicely, while canopy protects against UV rays.
pros: Powder coated steel frame measures 1.5-inch in diameter, providing a sturdy base
Includes a full length gray polyethylene canopy that will keep your vehicle dry and protected from the sun
Canopy has a zippered door that you can remove if desired
Easily transportable design, as it breaks down to a small size
cons: Can be tricky for one person to assemble and disassemble
Price is on the high end

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded All My Expectations
customer_reviews.text: Perfect winter shelter for my car. Heavy duty construction. This has held to high winds and the 2018 “Bomb Cyclone” here on the East coast without any issues. Exceeded all my expectations!
customer_reviews.author: JDP007

customer_reviews.title: Does not recommend for rain.
customer_reviews.text: Initially it seems to be very good heavy duty product but after couple days of rain water went right through it. See the picts. I was very surprise because the tarp material seems great but it does not keep water out. I gave it 2 stars because the overall construction material/frame are great. It would be 5 stars if the cover did not leaks water. Too combersum to return it otherwise I will.
customer_reviews.author: Robwinn

customer_reviews.title: Good quality - sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty material and strong zippers. Definitely need 2 people when assembling the poles. Instructions were good. All hardware included. Great size with plenty of room for my 2006 Suzuki C50 Boulevard cruiser. I live in New England. Hopeful this will hold up during heavy snow/blizzards. I added 6 cinder blocks on the inside with straps to ensure it stays put. I would recommend this canopy.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia J Macres

customer_reviews.title: we had winds peaking about 40 to 55mph and for to days straight and happy to report it held like a champ now I ...
customer_reviews.text: I have to say ,we had winds peaking about 40 to 55mph and for to days straight and happy to report it held like a champ now I know it can handle some serious winds from El Paso tx. Great car port.🙂🙂🙂🙂🙂
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted a year
customer_reviews.text: This cover only lasted a year for me. The whole top started tearing across the front of the canopy. I treated it very well, so I'm baffled by why it just stared ripping all over the top. When I contacted Abba about their warranty, they said there wasn't one and told me I could buy a new cover from them for $100, plus shipping. They had a warranty on it when I purchased it originally in 2018, but I guess that doesn't matter anymore. I'll never buy anything from Abba again.
customer_reviews.author: Brady

customer_reviews.title: Disintegrated in the sun in less than 6 months!
customer_reviews.text: Sure we live in Colorado where we get 300 days of sun but I would expect the UV treatment to last longer than 6 months! I already have a hole in the roof... and now have to start searching for a better cover to replace it with. Really had high hopes for this as the frame was solid and everything fit nicely. UGH! First picture is of the roof, the next is after rubbing it with my hand, then the hole starting in the roof, then a picture of the side close up with the waterproofing peeling then the the whole thing. No response from seller yet...
customer_reviews.author: Jon K

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Holes
customer_reviews.text: I'd like to give this a higher rating but the shed has been getting a lot of holes in it and and it's only been a couple of months. I'm afraid of what will happen when the weather turns worse during winter. It's a shame because it looks decent, assembly was fairly easy, but what does that matter if it won't last too long.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M

customer_reviews.title: Very solid unit, lacks venting.
customer_reviews.text: It appears to be very well made, the frame is very solid, the fabric seems very heavy duty and fits snug to the frame. Removable door panel creates a tight seal. Very easy to assemble with two people. Only issues is a real problem with condensation inside the enclosure, everything gets soaked, had to tarp what I put in there, somewhat defeats the point of getting it. I am going to have to add vents to it. Should be manufactured with them already in it.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Goodridge

customer_reviews.title: These don’t leak
customer_reviews.text: These storage shelters or motorcycle garage in my case are made good and really worth the money. I was able to put it together pretty easy by myself by using electrical tape to hold the poles together. The thing I couldn’t believe is how people say these leak when they are brand new. They don’t leak, it’s humidity build up when the door is shut. Just go to Home Depot and get some house vents and put one at each end. Problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Smitty

customer_reviews.title: Structurally sound but , could not withstand one Texas summer.
customer_reviews.text: Update, This structure is very sturdy once the tent is on, however it is not that UV resistant, it went through one Texas summer and the top of the tent has deteriorated, lots of tiny holes and thinning of the material, I have lots of experience being part a Burning man festivals and for camping in general. I have put up and taken down many types of structures and this is easy to assemble and very sturdy. The only tiny issue was one of the lower sides was missing a grommet hole, and we think the poles should snap together.
customer_reviews.author: LisaB

customer_reviews.title: Total junk, do not buy!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this just over a year ago, the top totally rotted out from the sun, I thought it was supposed to be sun proof, at least for more than a year. I asked what the warranty was and was told 3 years, then when I sent them a claim that warranty suddenly became 1 year. This product is total junk, I would never buy one again, and I would definitely not recommend it to anyone. Just very disappointed with the product, and the seller.
customer_reviews.author: TLM

customer_reviews.title: Two person assmebly job.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for my Bobcat 543 to keep it out of the weather. It does take at least two people to assemble and the spikes provided to anchor the shelter don't do well in asphalt - even with pre-drilled holes. they either bend or the head breaks off .
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Yarnall

customer_reviews.title: Look no further for a DISPOSABLE shed! Falls apart after 1-year warranty. Manufacturer no help.
customer_reviews.text: Just after the warranty expires, expect the tarp to fall apart (see photos). This was in Northern California, so not that hot / sunny. Contacting manufacturer was not helpful. Their response was "out of warranty." This despite sending the same photos and only about 3 months out of warranty. Clearly this didn't happen overnight. When I asked to buy a new tarp, I got no response at all. I might try to duct tape the whole and keep it going for a bit more, but can't recommend for anything other than temporary shelter, at which point there are much better options.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not last through a Phoenix, AZ summer.
customer_reviews.text: The shelter set up fine, and is sturdy, but the material deteriorated and fell apart at the seams after one summer in the Phoenix heat. Probably fine for more moderate climates, but do not buy if you have hot, sunny summers.
customer_reviews.author: Judy A. Grabski

customer_reviews.title: NOT WATER RESISTANT
customer_reviews.text: This product was easy to assemble and feels very sturdy. Unfortunately that is where the accolades stop. This is NOT AT ALL WATER RESISTANT. When it snows, it sweats on the inside and soaks everything. If that was the only source of water it would be almost forgiveable but when it rains, water will literally poor through the roof almost as if there was nothing there at all. What is the point of this thing if it doesn't keep water out?
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: Spend more, get something better.
customer_reviews.text: Hard to assemble which is an issue because it constantly falls apart and blows away with even the smallest breeze. If you get it you will need to get creative on how to keep it on tur ground, the four small nails that come with it do not work. It does not have a flange at the bottom of the tent and so wind and water/rain still get inside it, making it rather pointless.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Ruggles

customer_reviews.title: It looks ok and my tractor fits inside
customer_reviews.text: The construction was simple. The cover went in fairly easily. But it did not snug down easily on the back side and the door Velcro I s not easy to fit. The one part I do have a problem with is I am using to store my lawn tractor in. Thank goodness I did not grow the cover from it away. This “shed” was soaking wet inside when I went inside it two days after construction. I had to cover tractor with it’s original cover because tractor was soaked with condensation. That’s my big issue. Other issue, buy some good spikes to secure. The ones provided are useless in a high wind.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Towers

customer_reviews.title: Sunlight glitters through the cover material where the obvious unwanted ...
customer_reviews.text: Sunlight glitters through the cover material where the obvious unwanted wear and tear will start... so I bought some duct tape ready to patch it up through this coming hot summer of southern California.
customer_reviews.author: Snoopy

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product, fell apart!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this shed 16 months ago - it is literally disintegrated! It’s crazy, but the surface is just falling apart and it’s no longer water proof in the least. If it can’t sit in the sun, and can’t keep out the rain, what good is it?
customer_reviews.author: Mary OC

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Had someone put it up for me since I’m a senior and unable to. They said it was easy. Live in southern New Mexico were we get real high winds in the spring. Last week was the real test! We had winds 30 to 50 mph winds with gust over 60 mph. Shed held up without any problems! Did have pallets laid down over some pavers and plywood on the top, painted and then the shed bolted down on top. The ground is very sandy here. Very happy with my purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Came in a nicely packed heavy duty box. Easy to assemble, simple instructions. Heavy cover, white inside. Door is sealed by Velcro. Frame is basically held together by the cover fitting over it. Lower cross tubes slip through the cover and bolted clamps hold it in place. Long nail stakes hold the shelter in place. As is; I would only recommend this shelter for temporary use. Attaching the feet to boards (stops the frame from spreading) and adding screws to secure the tubes then tying the frame to ground anchors, would stabilize the frame and help in strong winds. Accurately made, fits together well.
customer_reviews.author: DRKO

customer_reviews.title: NOT Made to Last :(
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to put together and is the perfect size to park my motorcycle in. However, within six months of use, both zippers ripped off of the seams. Now, after almost two years of use, the roof has naturally split apart because of sunlight deterioration. Don't they test the durability of their product? How frustrating! Now, I need to find a replacement tarp to protect my bike when the rains come ;(
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Easier to assemble than I would have ever guessed!
customer_reviews.text: So far, Great! The assembly was very easy. Only a little help from my girl friend. Just help to steady and feed cover. I did get luck on guessing how to pull the cover over the 10 ft. frame. But it worked! I received the box at 4pm and was completely done by 7pm. I took my time. Instructio xx were just pictures.... Worked! The 10 x 10 unit is tall so you need a step ladder. Time will tell on the sturdiness. The frame seems strong.... I have anchored to asphalt. I live in New England. So it will be challenged. So far, happy as I can be, at this stage.
customer_reviews.author: EdNH

customer_reviews.title: Leaky
customer_reviews.text: Not very hard to assemble with two people. It only takes a couple of hours max. The reason for two stars is that it is definitely not water proof. There are drops of rain coming down on inside from all over not just the seams. It offers partial protection from the rain only.
customer_reviews.author: Liberty

customer_reviews.title: Worst experience ever...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived missing hardware. Couldn't just send hardware, had to send a whole new one, then I had to repack the old one to be sent back... got new one and Amazon was supposed to send a return label in the box, which there wasn't... leaking after very first rain... what a nightmare... and I am going to be very upset if I cant get this straightened out and get charged again.... wont ever buy something big like this online again....
customer_reviews.author: Tyler H.

customer_reviews.title: Did not want a Shed
customer_reviews.text: Got this because of the reviews and did not want a shed, was easy to assemble, is very sturdy, has been through some really violent storms and has stood up like a champ. The only thing it needs is a vent for the heat but just have to unzip the from flap on one side and that problem is solved, just check for critters, lol. Really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Price

customer_reviews.title: not for harsh climates
customer_reviews.text: I live in Northern Michigan. I set this up in the morning and strong breezes came and blew it away in the afternoon. I'm going to have to buy heavy duty ground anchors to make this work and to get my money's worth. The ones that come with it are useless in strong wind. Also, the instructions are lame and the parts are incorrectly labelled. If you want something long term and solid, spend the money.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad Johnson

customer_reviews.title: This product has survived two major storms in the first three weeks of use!
customer_reviews.text: The last three weeks brought 50 mph winds and another storm that dumped 6" of rain in one morning. Still standing and still dry inside. I put this together by myself, and while I would would not recommend that, it was possible. The printed instructions were adequate, the materials were all included, and we're of acceptable quality. One suggestion if the unit is to be attached to the ground: purchase ground and ratcheting straps for extra stability. The small extra cost and effort provides peace of mind. I don't know how durable this storage unit will be, but so far it has kept my riding mower, push mower, and wheelbarrow dry and safe in bad weather. A five-star worthy purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: As a one man crew the frame of this shed was a little annoying to get up but I managed to do it. Overall this shed doesn't take too much time to put together. I would secure this shed with other things instead of relying on the supplied stakes alone. I would also add some other tarps to the exterior of the shed to keep the water out. The fabric provided for this shed does not keep rainfall out 100 percent. I have had my shed up for a few months now and zero issues after I added a few things to it.
customer_reviews.author: atholloman343

customer_reviews.title: Would be better with a vent
customer_reviews.text: These condense moisture at night. Stuff inside gets wet from condensation. A screened vent near the ridge at both ends is really needed. to help reduce that. It can be done DIY with a couple square feet of insect screen, adhesive backed velcro tape, a robust sewing machine, plus a couple square feet of material that matches what it is made out of. Now if Iknew what that material is or had some way to buy it. I'd fix that design defect. Otherwise it is pretty good for temporary storage.
customer_reviews.author: George E. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Additional Work Required!
customer_reviews.text: This unit was assembled per instructions, and blew apart with a strong wind. I had to drill through every pipe fitting to keep the pipes together. I also ended up anchoring it into asphalt, as the entire unit lifted off the ground and blew across the street. Now that it is secured and anchored, it seems to be holding up very well! In my opinion, the pipe connections should either be spring locked or come designed with bolts and nuts to hold the thing together.
customer_reviews.author: D. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Happy initially, but didn't even last 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Was quite happy when I put the product up initially. Quality seemed fine, assembly wasn't too bad. I did it solo, though it would have been a lot easier with a second hand. Less than 2 years later, and the material is completely failing. i wish I had checked this before the year was up because I'm sure the failure would have been starting then and I could have attempted a warranty. This is shaded by my house, so only gets sun on it about half the day. I imagine if it was sitting out on it's own it would have failed even sooner. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: CarNut

customer_reviews.title: Only lasts one year!
customer_reviews.text: After one summer it's already trash. The cover is not UV resistant and had already started to shred. ***** When you first start assembling this, everything will be crazy loose. But once the conver is attached everything locks into place and it becomes quite sturdy. Definitely need two people to assemble this. Because our states stop loose one person can't both hold it stable and add the next set of pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Allen

customer_reviews.title: Not at all durable to mild weather exposure
customer_reviews.text: Have had this product for about a year and the cover has ran it course (sun/wind damaged) not very durable but when trying to order a replacement cover they are out of stock and don’t know when they will have more. So basically there will be zero support from the manufacturers. Don’t expect this to last or to be able to get replacement parts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy this, you will love it.
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally write reviews, but I felt the need on this purchase. Awesome material, durable, my teen and I put it together easily in half an hour. I put it off a long time because I thought it was going to be a pain to put up. Easy peasy. Very thick tarp material, so happy with this purchase, will likely order another because I love it so much.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Phillips

customer_reviews.title: poor quality control. poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: waited almost 2 weeks for this to show up. frame is the right size, the tent material is short, looks to be a 6 x 6 or less tent on a 6 x 8. seller does not answer calls, on hold for over 1/2 hour twice. you can leave a message and an agent will call you back, never happened. i do not like giving bad reviews, but honestly this one deserves it. Glad i bought thru amazon so i can at least get my money back look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Ouellette

customer_reviews.title: Tape connections of metal frame. Also add four addition stakes to hold it in place!
customer_reviews.text: I live in Lake Tahoe where we receive 600/700 inches of snow in winter. I installed this yesterday. Tape all parts connection with 3m blue tape. Was able to built frame in 40 minutes. The cover really needs two people to snug into place. Tight fit but easy with two. Due to snow added four PVC rafters zip tied into ceiling. Also added power for lights and battery tender. My 2018 Kawasaki Versy 1000 with top case fits inside perfect!!!! Well made! Also added floor mat. One light heats the whole area when closed!
customer_reviews.author: L W S

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this storage shelter because I’m renting a house for a relatively short period. I’m extremely pleased with how easy it was to assemble the shelter. My teenage son and I put it together in about 20 minutes. I’m also pleased with the sturdiness of the frame and fabrics. I use it to store my lawnmower and other outdoor items. Be mindful of the fact that it gets insanely hot inside the shelter in the summer. I do wish it had some sort of weatherproof vent to help with that issue.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Bloomquist

customer_reviews.title: Well-constructed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to store garden carts and lawnmower in back yard. Took about 2.5 hours to put together (2 handy adults). Using duct tape to hold tubes together (from a previous reviewer) is good advice - you are well advised to follow it. All parts appear to be very well-made and sturdy. Directions (photos only, no text) are clear and very easy to follow. All pieces present - but suggest a few more stakes are provided. Plan to go out and buy more to secure the legs better. True test will be this winter...can it survive snow? Giving 4 stars vs. 5 stars for these last 2 reasons.
customer_reviews.author: Tom P.

customer_reviews.title: just what l was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: love this shed, got it for my Harley Fatboy. Plenty of roomful bike . would recommend it to every body. It rained a few inches past few days with strong wind gust, not one problem. LOVE IT!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Nightmare to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to protect my smoker grill. It was the most challenging thing I have ever had to put together. Instructions were vague and it required basically 3 people to assemble it as you need help people holding ends while you connect them. It was floppy and flimsy too. After you put on the tarp and secure it down with the ties it begins to feel better, but definitely not worth the cost it was
customer_reviews.author: Christian Payan

customer_reviews.title: Met our expectations!!
customer_reviews.text: We love this storage shelter. My husband and I had it up in 65 minutes. It is well made and comes with clear and easy instructions. We will be using it for all of our lawn art and lawn equipment such as the lawn tractor and push mower as well as our snow blower. This will free up a lot of space in the garage and our walk out basement which has been over flowing for years now. Great product and we are well pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Just finished putting together my portable shed. It took about 21/2 hours by myself. All the parts were in the box. The directions easy to follow. I am very impressed and happy with the purchase, it is very well made and appears very much a good buy. I highly recommend this product. I can now go ahead and purchase my new John Deere. Revron
customer_reviews.author: revron

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed in the product. It started when I found a huge lump of falling apart cardboard on my front steps. It did not get any better upon turning it over and had parts falling out. I took alot of pics. Upon opening, some parts are rusted and I have no way of knowing if any parts are missing as there are no instructions. I'm assuming that most of the bolts/nuts are missing as they were loose in the box. I would never have bought this product if I had known this is the shape that it would arrive. What a horrible product. I do not recommend at all.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Staley

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, some hardware came rusted
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Instructions are quite clear and everything is well labeled. Took about 1.5 hours with two people to get it all done. I'd recommend getting some more substantial ground anchors to hold it down if it is in a windy location. A negative is that all the hardware to bolt things together came corroded. Not sure how long they're going to last.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: No vents, hardware is very cheaply made, bolt heads on several of the bolts broke off , purchased new nut and bolts at Lowe’s. I intended to put classic car in for winter but being there is no ventilation will be renting garage for car. I will use for storing lawn mower and such. Do not recommend!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to protect my classic car from rain and sunlight. This product didn't even last a year before it started to fall apart. The seller claims its durable and it protects from the inside from the sun. If you buy a carport your lead to believe it will last ...not forever but definitely for a few years. I contacted the seller and they were not willing to provide any assistance what so ever. On top of that I live in northern California I dont get snow and our heat waves are low 100s usually only happen one or two weeks through the entirety of the summer months. I do not recommend this product at all.
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORTHY TO RECOMMEND, PERIOD!!!👎👎👎
customer_reviews.text: Very POOR quality, NOT rain resistant, causing buildup of moisture inside the tent, and NOT worthy enough to recommend this cheaply made mini carport! Buyer BEWARE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Air

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY, WASTE OF MONEY
customer_reviews.text: This Product does not stand up, The wind has Ripped the cover after only a few months. I have tried calling their customer service but have had no luck as twice I was on hold only to have them hang up on me. They don't seem to care about the product they offer after the sale. This is a waste of your money.
customer_reviews.author: jason s.

customer_reviews.title: beware
customer_reviews.text: We installed this canopy structure to house a boat. Well, not even a month later it blew away after a semi-strong wind. Now we have bent parts, and holes in the tarp. We wrote to the company and have yet to get a response.
customer_reviews.author: VB

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap bought it for my firewood and it leaks
customer_reviews.author: vkoukas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Bike Storage
customer_reviews.text: We're a family with bikes Needed to make room in the garage, so 7 bikes had to go outside, but I wanted them covered. This worked out perfectly. 2 Beach Cruisers, 4 Road Bikes and 1 kid's bike
customer_reviews.author: A N

customer_reviews.title: Great investment!
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to assemble, but did take two people. It is sturdy with a metal frame. It had t rained yet so I do t know how water resistant it is. Only problem we had was delivery. Received it a week after the promised delivery date. It was the carriers fault, but Amazon did nothing to remedy the problem!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just right to cover our lawn mower.
customer_reviews.text: We needed something to cover our lawn mower since our garage is too full. It does the job and was tough enough not to blow away during our windy weather this winter.
customer_reviews.author: Lin Walk

customer_reviews.title: Good open ended shelter, horrible door zippers
customer_reviews.text: Just got this tent put together. The frame fell apart on me 3 times before I resorted to securing the sections with duct tape. From that point on, assembly became very easy. The tent seems pretty sturdy. I'm quite disappointed in the door zipper. One side got stuck on it's first use and the other by the 3rd. I'm afraid I'm going to have to force it open and hope I don't tear the tarp, then find a different way to hold it closed.
customer_reviews.author: Micpar

customer_reviews.title: Solid storage shed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this storage shed to cover my motorcycle in my driveway as I lack a garage. Assembly was simple, the size was more than enough for coverage of a Ducati Monster along with some extra motorcycle stuff. It doesn't leak and serves its purpose well. I am pretty happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Morris

customer_reviews.title: IMO not worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: Zipper on the door broke after a few months and the cover deteriorated after about a year. I've had it for about 18 months and the cover has started to rip along the rig pole. I had to get another tarp and cover it to keep the rain out. For the cost, I would expect this to last a lot longer. Sorry I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen A. Whittaker

customer_reviews.title: Great Shed
customer_reviews.text: We needed a shed for our riding lawn mower and other outdoor/yard equipment. So far this has been great. No problems in wind or rain and we’re able to set it up in less than an hour. Worth spending a bit more to buy this one. It’s much better quality than any we’ve had in the past
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Russell

customer_reviews.title: Holding up so far
customer_reviews.text: This needed 3 people to put it together and the poles kept sliding apart so we used duct tape to hold them together -- after a lot of swearing it is all up and works fine and is probably the best thing you can get to keep a wood pile dry all winter --for not very much money
customer_reviews.author: LindaG

customer_reviews.title: Mostly a one person job
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these shelters I have bought. This one came with a pole with a small amount of damage, but the pole was still straight enough to assemble. This can be assembled by one person until you get to putting the canvas on, there is almost no way to that part by yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: A good shelter for the money
customer_reviews.text: It is true that this shelter is easier to put up with two people, but with some duct tape the poles can be held together so the frame can be fully assembled. I used anti-seize on the hardware, as when the box was opened it showed all the bolts with flash rust. Some of the tubes were mis-marked, but the directions and diagrams sorted that out well. It has held up to 10" of snow so far this season, hopefully it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Mario W.

customer_reviews.title: Bingo...
customer_reviews.text: Bingo....perfect for our riding lawn mower. We put all the pieces and followed the instructions, first Tom we'r hadn't haff any process missing or couldn't understand the instructions. My husband is very picky about these types of things but here was pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jennell Gaines

customer_reviews.title: Temporary Storage Problem solved
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these. They were easy to set up, and they are really roomy. I cleaned out a 7X15 storage shed and two storage sheds worked with a some room to spare. These babies saved me $400 a month on storage.
customer_reviews.author: J. Corbett

customer_reviews.title: Does not last
customer_reviews.text: My cover ripped in one year. And they don't even sell replacement covers. Now it's bolted into my cement and worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Petrified Vinyl
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy Frame, however the vinyl shell is cheap crap. My unit is only 6 months old, the vinyl shell is cracking and breaking down. Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Herman Munster

customer_reviews.title: Seems  sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy and fits my ATV just fine, made stakes to hold it down and in place,the 4 spike nails that came with it would no way be enough, tent portion seems tough only time will tell if it holds up under the sun and rain, but so far I am very happy with it and am optimistic!
customer_reviews.author: Tmac

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and works well.
customer_reviews.text: Set-up was pretty straight forward and I did it on my own though having help would have made it go a bit quicker. At any rate, it took about 1.5 hrs to assemble. The tarp material is fairly heavy duty and hopefully will last many years. The zippers could be more robust and I'm concerned they won't last as long as the rest of it. Overall it's a great backyard "garage" for my motorbike and very cost effective.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Shack

customer_reviews.title: Thought it was great at first! 😕
customer_reviews.text: We loved this at first! Very easy to set up and works great for storing our quad and lawn mower. The issue is it is just over a month old and there is already a tear in the roof and water and he sun leaks in. This defeats the purpose of king our stuff dry and out of the sun. Very sad! I would love to contact the company and see if they can do anything, but can’t figure out whom to contact.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Navarro

customer_reviews.title: Nice little storage shelter for the money
customer_reviews.text: The package came complete and I began working on putting it together. One person can do it, but its better with two. Where the metal tubes come together, I used a metal screw at each joint to ensure they don;t come apart. Instructions were good and easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: G. Wade

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This little carport is amazing. I love the overhang of the sides to keep the inside warmer. In my harsh winter my car is safe and never has frost on it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Intense Inside Condensation
customer_reviews.text: The objective goal of my purchase was to keep the contents dry. I have not made that move yet as I just got it assembled. As it happens, it rained last night and upon inspection this morning, I discovered that the condensation on the inside promises NOT to keep the contents dry. One review from "Smitty" indicated to get a couple of house vents and put one on each end. I am willing to do that but would like to know how to attach the vents to the tent fabric and what size vents to get. My storage shed is a small one, only a 6x8. Would like someone to answer back on this one. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not sure how long will last.
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy but the biggest draw back is the seams and a few spot you can see Light. They are not holes but seem weak. Vendor needs to contact me and see if i can add anything to bond to sides. Probably would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: TC Tesla Collins

customer_reviews.title: Problematic Assembly but I’m glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Storage Shelter to help declutter the house. I put it together myself and had a little bit of trouble because none of the poles and joints snap together so it would fall apart when I tried to lift it up onto th legs. I solved that issue by Duct taping all of the joints. Aside from that and very vague directions, once the shelter is completed it is pretty spacious and sturdy. I am very happy to have more space in my house and the belongings tucked away out of the weather.
customer_reviews.author: Maryerin Gray

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy and affordable storage option.
customer_reviews.text: We needed extra storage for our yard equipment and assorted tools and materials over the Winter and this was the perfect option for cheap money. I’m super happy with it. Just added wooden pallets and a plywood floor to keep things off the ground and everything is now out of the elements and safe.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Copp

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty means heavy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this enclosure since the wife complained that we didn’t have a space in the backyard for setting things out of the sun during outdoor parties. I wanted something durable that wouldn’t blow over/ away and could be used multiple times and survive inebriated guests. While I still haven’t put it up since it’s the middle of winter here in the Midwest, I think this will do the trick. Note of caution, this item weighs about 120 lbs. It will take two people to move it, your delivery guy will probably not be very happy dragging it to your door.
customer_reviews.author: agtrneu

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: put it up myself in 2-3 hours(70 years old). most difficult part- installing 30" anchors purchased by themselves
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly sturdy
customer_reviews.text: It’s been great all winter. It handled a few snowstorms and some very heavy wind. You will need a few people to stand it up to full height. Super easy to put together and surprisingly sturdy. If I needed another one I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas mcgowan

customer_reviews.title: New bolts only issue
customer_reviews.text: Get yourself some better stakes for the ground and new bolts with lock nuts and this will be a great shed. Bolt stripped out trying to tighten so had to go get a new one but it felt alot more sturdy. Make sure when putting in the cross bars that goes through the canopy to push down to tighten it on top.
customer_reviews.author: Heezay

customer_reviews.title: customer service
customer_reviews.text: I had problems with stitching at the roof line , about 12" or so , but the company was very good and sent another cover n/c
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Temp Shed Holds Up
customer_reviews.text: Bought this shed for my garden tools as a temporary solution until I build a permanent shed and it held up when 24 inches of snow got dumped on us upstate. Holds all my outdoor tools and equipment.
customer_reviews.author: P. Waters

customer_reviews.title: Great...except for the zippers
customer_reviews.text: Easily assembled by 1 person if you use the Gorilla-Tape trick mentioned by one of the other commenters. Well made and sturdy except for the zippers. The zippers on the door are cheep, difficult to operate, and the door material constantly gets stuck in the zipper.
customer_reviews.author: bem

customer_reviews.title: Solid option for budget outdoor storage
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble. Two people make it easier but not required. A trick so to tape all the joints together for the top before you put the legs on. The top is tight fitting and does not flap around or make noise in the wind. The door also fits well with relatively sturdy zippers. I’d keep it out of heavy sun load if possible, but overall it seems worth the price for an outdoor storage option.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased, would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Frame assembly simple and easy to assemble. Since I was working alone, I ran a self drilling/self tapping sheet metal screw into each joint. This didn’t take much extra time and eliminated the need for a helper and allowed me to scoot the assembled frame, tweaking the exact resting place. If I had a need, I would buy again. Can’t beat it especially for the price. Mine is in a wooded area and would have liked a camouflage cover but the dark gray is ok.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie Agnor

customer_reviews.title: Easy Shed
customer_reviews.text: This shed is very easy to set up. I had a friend help, but I could have done it alone easily enough. It seems sturdy. I have not had it long enough to tell how durable it is.
customer_reviews.author: Gravy Soppin Mofo

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set up. Great Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up. Use duct tape to secure poles as this made it easy for a 1 person setup. Only needed 2 people at the end to put the canopy on. Very sturdy but I’d add additional tent stakes to the feet. The canvas is very durable so far. Fits my grill, golf cart, and 4 bikes.
customer_reviews.author: B. Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces...unsatisfied
customer_reviews.text: It was missing some parts like screws and I needed it immediately so I ended up buying the parts at the store which cost an extra $17.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.text: If its anywhere near a tree.... Make sure you have high quality outdoor capable 3m duct tape. Any old branch getting blown around in a storm will make holes in the roof and sides.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Size Matters
customer_reviews.text: SIZE MATTERS !!!!! I looked at the pics showing a car in the shed, unless your car is a matchbox car it won't fit. This thing is SMALL !!!
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect choice for my sons 4 wheeler and trailer. Will add years to the trailer and he leaves the 4 wheeler on it and just backs in. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin S. Frost

customer_reviews.title: Weathered the storm...
customer_reviews.text: I recommend using duct tape to hold the pieces together as you assemble it. Also, moving it after assembling the frame was hard with only two people and 2x4s, so plan accordingly. The pieces fit together well and the material is sturdy. I did install 4 extra tent pegs and a screw-in anchor due to an impending storm. It still stands after 60-65-mph gusts!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT WATER RESISTANT
customer_reviews.text: This is not rain resistant. We live in California where it barely rains and In the 3 days of small bits of rain we had, the water went through and creating like a moisture inside and started molding. NOT water resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Arias

customer_reviews.title: Will buy another
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for a year and a half now and still love it. Because it has more of a skirt pallets were put around the edges to hold them down but that is only because we use this as a feed tent for our ranch.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: cover is bad at least mine is I bought it to put my motorcycle under sad it's still
customer_reviews.text: Mine has little holes in it and some of the seems and worse
customer_reviews.author: Michael E.

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. The hold down system is lacking. Came with spikes that were useless. Suggest buying anchors and ratchet straps door is excellent design. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: JD S.

customer_reviews.title: It's a toy!
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be large enough to fit a Chevy Equinox. Wrong....
customer_reviews.author: Original Settler

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to house our riding lawnmower and so far so good. I gave it a 4 due to water getting in when it is storming but otherwise we are happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy McNamara

customer_reviews.title: Nice little tent
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was not 100% clear. The inside cross beam is actually meant to go through the slides in the interior walls of this unit. It is not in the instructions, at all. Otherwise, medium grade material, lightweight, effective, waterproof, and very convenient. Took 2 hours for assembly for me being alone. You may want to assemble the top before the legs....
customer_reviews.author: Philip Simonin

customer_reviews.title: Eventually these get holes and tear
customer_reviews.text: This is a good little tent. But don’t expect it to last more than a season or two before it starts getting holes. Most of these style tents are like this. The best thing to do is add a tarp to it after a year or two.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for keeping my motorcycle dry and not sun baked. Bought 6 cinder blocks to hold it down and some rope. I'll add a photo soon.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe this is being sold!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, there are small holes in the canopy, as others have said. But more frustrating is that the canopy doesn't fit the fame correctly. Even after twisting, and pounding, the five horizontal sections are at least 2 inches too long. Rather than go to the work of packaging it up and returning it, I am going to use connectors that are longer and let one side of the door hang unattached.
customer_reviews.author: Richad Shaffer

product_meta.title: Abba Patio Outdoor Storage Shelter with Rollup Door Storage Shed Portable Garage Kit Tent for Motocycle Garden Storage Grey，6 x 8 ft
feature_bullets: Sturdy Heavy Weight Frame - The heavy duty storage shelter frame was designed with 1.5 inch heavy gauge steel and metal corner joints so that the shelter is more stable, safe and less shaky, especially during high winds. The steel frame is powder coated for rust resistance
Durable Triple Layer UV Treated Canopy - The triple layer 240 PE fabric is a heavy duty durable polyethylene that is UV and water resistant.
Detachable Rollup Zipper Door - This portable shed has a rollup door that is easy to put down on rainy or snowy days for better protection. The zipper door gives another level of protection.
One piece Top Cover and Sidewall Design - This feature gives the canopy a tight fit to the frame and also offers more stability for this storage shed.
Many Storage Uses - This storage shelter can be a motorcycle shed, storage tent for ATV, bike storage shed, garden and lawn equipment, tools, backyard items, childrens toys, firewood, etc.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars487 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
